subject: RE: [junit] Regarding Inner Class  - Junit

messageBody:
I'm having partial trouble understanding your description, but (in short) it
is possible. It's also possible to have a static nested class extending
JUnit's TestCase in your outer class, which is how I would do it. Example
follows:

package test.foo.bar;

import junit.framework.*;

public class Foo
{
public void doFoo() {
//...
}

/* nested class begins here. */
public static class FooTest extends TestCase
{
protected Foo f;

public FooTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}

protected void setup() {
//do stuff...
}

public static Test suite() {
return new TestSuite(FooTest.class);
}

public void testDoFoo() {
// do asserts...
}
} // end static nested test case
} // end outer class definition

Then to add the test class to your TestSuite:

suite.addTest(Foo.FooTest.suite())


Scott Stirling
Macromedia
